Digital Services Coordinator

Company Name Deakin University Company Location Burwood, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 184 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


JOB ID: 180673
SALARY RANGE: $78,117 to $84,361 pa (plus 17% super)
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full-time (36.75 hours per week) and continuing
LOCATION: Melbourne Burwood Campus

ABOUT THE ROLE

In this role you will work with the Manager, Digital Strategy and Operations to proactively support the information management, application improvement and responsiveness, and integration and digital implementation activities of the Graduate Employment Division.

This will include:

  • Provision of high-level technical support and advice to Graduate Employment staff and external clients undertaking the use of the Division's technologies.
  • Supporting the evaluation, development and integration of new and existing applications.
  • Providing continuous support to data and application management best practices.
  • Assisting with coordinating digital management solutions and other resources for staff such procedures, processes, training materials and knowledge base documentation.



ABOUT YOU

  • Tertiary degree in information technology or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and training.
  • Minimum of 2 years relevant experience/knowledge and demonstrated expertise in support across a variety of platforms/applications.
  • Demonstrated experience of working with HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, JQuery and PHP.
  • Proven computer literacy skills, including use of Microsoft Office suite, with attention to detail and a high level of accuracy.


For a full list of the selection criteria please see the position description


CONTACT FOR FURTHER INFORMATION: Saad Sheikh, Tel: +61 3 9246 8136, Email: s.sheikh@deakin.edu.au

CLOSING DATE: Sunday 9 September


We value our staff and understand that they are more than just their jobs, that's why we offer benefits that enhance work life. Further information on Deakin's workplace benefits can be found here: deakin.edu.au/about-deakin/work-at-deakin/why-work-at-deakin/staff-benefits

TO APPLY

For a full copy of the position description and to apply online, please visit deakin.edu.au/about-deakin/work-at-deakin

Deakin University values diversity, enables access and promotes inclusion.

Deakin University is an employer of choice for women and strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

Job description

Our client based in Geelong is seeking a Graduate Data Steward and Lead Data Steward to help build, maintain and support the Agency's growing Data Office.

About Us

The City of Whittlesea is one of the fastest growing municipalities in Australia. As a Council, we offer over 100 services to our public. Our workforce is diverse, with a wide range of nationalities, age groups, backgrounds and skills that enrich the workplace.

The Role
Are you a committed Open Space Planner and passionate about making a difference for the community?

Whittlesea is a fast growing, dynamic municipality in Melbourne’s north. We are known for our natural environment, family orientated community and balanced lifestyle.

In this role, you will help ensure the planning provision and development of high quality, functional and dynamic public open spaces and streetscapes in the growth areas of the municipality delivered by land developers

We will achieve this goal with the help of your skills in reviewing and ensuring subdivision landscape plans are designed and detailed in accordance with Council standards and industry benchmarks.

Ideally You

About You
  • Are a dedicated Open Space Planner
  • Possess comprehensive knowledge of general civil and landscape construction techniques, methods and procedures
  • Can connect and communicate with a range of partners
  • Handle multiple activities at a time; and
  • Use an enthusiastic approach to facilitate positive outcomes

Want to know more?
The full Position Description is available on

To apply for this position, you must address the Key Selection Critera outlined in the Position Description

  • Applications close 6pm Sunday, 23 September 2018

    • Please note all applicants must apply online and no late applications will be accepted

  • You must have the right to live and work in Australia to be eligible for this vacancy

We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce that reflects our municipality. [

Organisational Change Managers/Senior Change Analysts

Company Name Terra Firma Business Consulting Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 151 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Terra Firma we are all about making a positive difference for our clients, our consultants and our community.


What will you be doing?


Our clients range across industry sectors, and the engagements are diverse and varied, so you could be on client site supporting the implementation of security initiatives to ensure company and customers assets and information are secure, working on a project to grow customer advocacy or assisting an organisation to adopt new ways of working. And that’s just the start!


Is this you?


We are seeking skilled professionals who are passionate about generating meaningful change for clients and who are keen to belong to a company committed to bringing out their best, and supporting them along the way.


  • You are excited by the diversity that consulting offers
  • You are confident of your abilities to build and manage stakeholder relationships at all levels
  • You can quickly adapt to new environments and comfortably grasp new tools and concepts
  • You enjoy the challenge of problem-solving and thrive on innovation and creativity


What skills do you need?


  • You have a thorough working knowledge of current change management practices
  • You have significant project based organisational change management / change analysis experience preferably within a consulting environment
  • You have experience performing cross functional analysis across people, process and systems, and applying change management and business readiness tools and methodologies
  • You will have worked on large transformation projects and/or regulatory projects which impact large stakeholder groups
  • You will have developed training material and facilitated training that matched the business need
  • Ideally you will have worked in the Financial Services, Telecoms, Government or similar sectors
  • You may have, or be well on the way to having, accreditation in a leading Change Management Methodology e.g. PROSCI, PCI

HR Projects/ L&D Consultant

Company Name Cox Automotive Australia Company Location Altona North, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 126 views

Job description

  • Be part of an international group supporting global HR initiatives \xa0
  • Play a key coordination role in major HR transformational projects
  • Great company benefits and supportive of career development

\xa0

Reporting into our Group HR Director, the purpose of this role is to play a key role in supporting, developing and delivering effective, practical and cost effective people solutions and initiatives to managers and team members across Cox Automotive Australia. The HR Projects/ L&D Consultant role plays a key role in the HR team and assists the Group HR Director to deliver on organisational business objectives and priorities.

\xa0

As our new HR Projects/ L&D Consultant, you will be responsible for a variety of initiatives and projects within:


  • On-boarding and Induction.
  • Surveys and Reporting.
  • Learning, Leadership and Talent Programs.
  • Performance & Career Development.
  • Diversity, Values & Culture.
  • HR Projects & HR Communications.

\xa0

What do we need you to bring to the team?


Essential

  • Proven experience in a similar role in a fast paced organisation managing multiple projects / priorities simultaneously.
  • Professional career experience should include exposure to development, coordination and facilitation of training programs and workshops.
  • Confident facilitator to a wide range of audiences.
  • Strong presence and the ability to demonstrate credibility with senior leaders.
  • Exemplary written and verbal communication skills.
  • Highly organised and ability to manage multiple competing tasks.
  • Hands-on, pragmatic and ‘can-do’ attitude.
  • Excellent project management and time management skills.
  • Tertiary qualification in a Human Resources and/or Learning and Development discipline.
  • Current driver’s license.


Desirable

  • Certificate IV in Training and Assessment.
  • Project Management qualification.

\xa0

Why Cox Automotive?


A career with Cox Automotive family, gives you all the benefits that can only come from working for an industry leader, including talented, motivated team members; a diverse, energetic workplace; and a company dedicated to your success, growth and advancement.


We strive to create an environment that is entrepreneurial, nurtures personal development and builds on unique talents. Above all, it makes us a special company, one that can attribute its success to its products, clients, and most importantly, its team members.


We will provide you with an excellent induction and ongoing training to ensure you are able to perform the role to the highest level. You will be surrounded by a supportive, dynamic and fun team and will be rewarded and recognised for your hard work.


We have a range of benefits to take advantage of, such as Birthday Leave, Employee Assistance Program, Recognition Programs, discounts to BUPA Health Insurance, Travel Club, Snap Fitness and more!


So, if you are up for the challenge and have what we need you to bring to the team, then we would really like to hear from you.

\xa0

Please note, as part of our recruitment process, the successful applicant will be required to undergo a police check prior to confirmation of their ongoing employment with Cox Automotive. We are only able to consider applications from candidates with full Australian work rights and a current driver’s license.

851971014:
[

PM - Information Security - 12 month contract

Company Name Vocus Group Limited Company Location Level 10, 452 Flinders Street, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 72 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

As the fourth largest Telco in Australia, Vocus Group continues to grow and we are looking for an experienced Project Manager - Information Security. The Project Manager will be responsible for managing the end to end delivery of information security technology projects in accordance with agreed scope, schedule and budget. You will be responsible for managing the expectations of sponsors and stakeholders, managing project risks and developing contingency plans.
\xa0
This position will liaise on multiple levels with project team members, business users and various technical departments within Technology. To be successful in the position your in-depth technical knowledge will be enhanced by your exceptional communication and negotiation skills.

The day to day


  • Develop structured and realistic project plans, schedules and estimates for each project in their portfolio and ensure approvals obtained from the responsible authorities.
  • Manage the delivery of projects in their portfolio in accordance with agreed scope, budget and schedule.
  • Maintain an accurate and up-to-date view of deliverables across all projects in their portfolio.
  • Maintain an accurate record of all financial expenditure associate with projects in their portfolio.
  • Ensure that the weekly status reports are entered into the PPM (Clarizen) and associated systems to provide up-to-date status reports to the Technology Management team.
  • Liaise with CISO prior to submitting project plans or status update into the PPM (Clarizen) for an associated project.
  • Responsible for resource management of projects in their portfolios by liaising with other resource owners within Technology and other business units within Vocus and to external sources (vendors, subcontractors, etc.)
  • Ensure familiarity with and adherence to core ITIL Processes as employed at Vocus (e.g. Incident Management, Problem Management, Change Management).
  • Compliance to the Vocus Quality, Risk and Human Resource Reference Manuals, the Vocus Workplace Standards and the Vocus Employee Handbook.


What you need to bring to the table

  • 4+ years of Project Management experience in implementing information security technology in a midsize business environment is desirable.
  • Understanding of Information Security Governance.
  • Strong vendor and stakeholder management skills
  • Strong communication and planning skills
  • Experience in managing development & testing of changes internally and with 3rd party vendors
  • Experience in preparing detailed implementation & communications plans that also encompass non-IT components


Technical


  • High level understanding of IP Networks
  • High level understanding of Operational Systems Infrastructure
  • High level understanding of Business Systems infrastructure
  • Ability to conceptualise, launch and deliver Technology projects on time, within budget and to the agreed requirements.
  • Ability to communicate all project phases (i.e. development assembly, development delivery and operational), through project management software, written documentation and verbal presentations
  • Sound technical specification writing/documentation skills.


Business/Management


  • Understanding of Project Financing principles including Capital Expenditure, Operational Expenditure, Net Present Value and Total Cost of Ownership
  • Confidence and experience in engaging people at all level.
  • Sound knowledge and experience in formal program/project management methodologies such as PRINCE 2 / PMBOK.
  • Experience in planning, solution design, business case development and project management techniques.
  • Sound ability to analyse, isolate and interpret business needs and develop appropriate technical solutions.
